checkers

Class GameSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • checkers.GameSearch

  • public class GameSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the rules of Checkers. It also has methods for making the computer think using the minimax algorithm.

      • findAllValidMoves

        public static MoveList findAllValidMoves(Board board,
                                         int color)
        Returns the list of all valid moves for player "color" on "board". If a jump is possible, only jumps will be returned, since jumps are mandatory.

      • existJump

        public static boolean existJump(Board board,
                                int color)
        Returns true if there is a jump among the valid moves. It is used to test that the user does not make a normal move, when she can make a jump.

      • removeNormalMoves

        private static void removeNormalMoves(MoveList movelist)
        Removes normal moves from movelist. This is neccesary if the list contains jumps, since a jump is mandatory. A normal move should therefore not be considered if a jump exist.

      • minimaxAB

        public static Board minimaxAB(Board board,
                              int recursion,
                              int player,
                              Board alpha,
                              Board beta)
        Uses the "Minimax with alpha-beta cutoff" algorithm to find the best move for a player. However, unlike the normal minimax algorithm, which searches an already built game tree, this algorithm builds and evaluates the game tree concurrent ly.

      • minimax

        public static Board minimax(Board board,
                            int recursion,
                            int player)
